page.title: 08Farming
page.content: The farms in this area mainly rear sheep and store cattle.There are also a few dairy farms.The average farm is a hundred acres or more.In the summer hay is harvested although silage is becoming more popular,especially "big bale"silage. Farmers take their stock to the local livestock mart in Landovery,held in the shadow of the castle ruins,as well as those of neighbouring towns. There is a sale of fat lambs every fortnight and also breeding ewes in the Autumn. There is a monthly cattle market and annual horse sale. The average price of store cattle is 300 pounds, sheep 40 pounds and a horse 200 pounds. Some farmers supplement their income by offering holiday accomodation.
